input: Bob is red. Bob is rough. Dave is not blue. Dave is rough. Dave is white. Gary is blue. Gary is nice. Gary is red. Gary is rough. Harry is green. If someone is nice and rough then they are blue. If Harry is rough then Harry is nice. Furry, blue people are green. If Gary is nice then Gary is rough. All blue people are red. Green people are red. All red people are furry. If someone is green and furry then they are rough. If Harry is rough then Harry is white. Question: Harry is blue.?
output:
universe u

constant obj : Type u

constant Bob : obj
constant Dave : obj
constant Gary : obj
constant Harry : obj

constant Red : obj → Prop
constant Rough : obj → Prop
constant Blue : obj → Prop
constant White : obj → Prop
constant Green : obj → Prop
constant Nice : obj → Prop
constant Furry : obj → Prop

axiom T1 : Red Bob
axiom T2 : Rough Bob
axiom T3 : ¬ Blue Dave
axiom T4 : Rough Dave
axiom T5 : White Dave
axiom T6 : Blue Gary
axiom T7 : Nice Gary
axiom T8 : Red Gary
axiom T9 : Rough Gary
axiom T10 : Green Harry

axiom R1 : ∀ x : obj, Nice x ∧ Rough x → Blue x
axiom R2 : Rough Harry → Nice Harry
axiom R3 : ∀ x : obj, Furry x ∧ Blue x → Green x
axiom R4 : Nice Gary → Rough Gary
axiom R5 : ∀ x : obj, Blue x → Red x
axiom R6 : ∀ x : obj, Green x → Red x
axiom R7 : ∀ x : obj, Red x → Furry x
axiom R8 : ∀ x : obj, Green x ∧ Furry x → Rough x
axiom R9 : Rough Harry → White Harry

theorem harry_is_blue : Blue Harry :=
begin
  apply R1,
  split,
  apply R2,
  apply R8,
  split,
  exact T10,
  apply R7,
  apply R6,
  exact T10,
end

-- The answer is True
